DOC.brief_summary: The aim study investigate quality prehospital emergency care acute coronary syndrome , paramedic support telemedically EMS physician .
DOC.brief_title: Telemedical Support Prehospital Emergency Care Acute Coronary Syndrome
DOC.detailed_description: Six ambulance five different Emergency Medical Service ( EMS ) district equip portable telemedicine system . In case suspect acute coronary syndrome ( include STEMI ) , paramedic use system contact call `` tele-EMS physician '' consent patient obtain . The tele-EMS physician audio-connection EMS team receive vital parameter ( e.g. , ECG , pulse oximetry , non-invasive blood pressure ) real-time . Also 12-lead-ECGs transmit tele-EMS physician . The transmission still picture - take smartphone - video stream inside ambulance carry , meaningful . The tele-EMS physician support EMS team obtain relevant medical history , ECG diagnosis , general diagnosis delegate application medication . This carry bridge time arrival EMS physician less severe case without EMS physician on-scene . The quality prehospital care possible influence initial inhospital phase investigate compare regular EMS .
DOC.criteria: Suspected acute coronary syndrome Verbal consent teleconsultation obtain patient able consent due severity emergency Patient refuse consent teleconsultation No suspect acute coronary syndrome
